processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has been processed using minimal processing standards: the originial arrangement has been maintained, the container list is brief and simple, and the records have not been refoldered and fastners have not been removed.

Material found loose in boxes was foldered and given a title determined by the archivist. In cases where folder titles were inaccurate, the titles have been corrected to more adequately describe material.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Governor Linwood Holton's top priority for the 1972 session of the General Assembly was a proposal for the Governor's Cabinet, reorganizing state agencies into six major departments - each headed by a secretary appointed by the governor. The office of the Secretary of Transportation and Public Safety was created on April 8, 1972, by an act passed by the General Assembly. The office has undergone a series of administrative changes since. On April 12, 1976, the General Assembly established separate secretariats for transportation and public safety. On July 1, 1984, the offices were again combined. Most recently, on February 22, 1990, the Secretary of Transportation and Public Safety was once again divided into separate secretariats.

The Secretary of Transportation and Public Safety was responsible for the following departments: Dept. of Transportation, Dept. of Aviation, Dept. of Motor Vehicles, Dept. of Emergency Services, Dept. of Fire Programs, Dept. of Military Affairs, Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control, Dept. of Correctional Education, Dept. of Corrections, Dept. of Youth Services, Dept. of Criminal Justice Services, Dept. of State Police and the Virginia Parole Board.

The individuals who served as Secretary of Transportation and Public Safety were: Wayne A. Whitham (1972-1976), Franklin E. White (1984-1985), Andrew B. Fogarty (1985-1986) and Vivian E. Watts (1986-1990).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence and subject files for the Secretary of Transportation from January 1989 to December 1991.
